text: |Filter hints like Google Sheets that reference the HubL Reference while editing code (see Screenshot) — Just a thought… (the HubL reference is really useful, but this would be cool)

heh William Spiro had a similar idea  for the chrome extension way back <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/issues/127>
If interested in contributing :wink: that’d be a pretty boss feature to add. ( there’s a link in the github to a proof of concept)
Neat idea! that’d be sweet to have, but I’m definitely not the person to build it :disappointed: Wish I had the chops

Yea I’m kinda right up that alley myself. The only way I could see doing it safely is if I had full control over the code editor kinda deal. I don’t like the pain it might be to try to add the feature ontop of the code editor’s stuff that it has going on

Would be awesome if repeatable fields in the editor had a way to go “next item” “previous item” “add item after this one”

It would definitely improve the speed at which content could be entered making repeatable fields feel less tedious
You mean a button that would cycle to the next repeater item in the page editor?
So you don’t have to go back to the root module then into the next item?
If that’s what you mean then I’m on board.
Yes that is exactly what I mean.

Suggested it before but suggesting it again as it’s not implemented - would be great if in the new menu when you go to the all accounts drop down - if there was a search field just like on the account dashboard screen.

I have 60+ HS accounts I’m connected to. as much as I love having easy access to the list there, I’m definitely not going to waste time scrolling in a mini-box. I’d totally search it though and love not having to go back to the account dashboard to switch.
Can this be pasted into ideas for GDrive as well? Moving files around in there is a chore
